com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface packShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface packShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document packShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      packShipment is used to pack items from shipment lines into containers.

    • Method Detail

      • packShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document packShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        packShipment is used to pack items from shipment lines into containers. This process is typically employed for parcel shipments, since it is required that shipments be completely containerized for it to be included in a manifest. However, you can pack other types of shipments too.

        Packing does not result in change of shipment status. Therefore, pack is not a pipeline transaction. However, the shipment_containerized_flag in YFS_SHIPMENT is updated to either of the following:
      • 02 - containerization is in progress
      • 03 - containerization has been completed
        Valid shipment status for the pack operation is governed by the status modification rules for modification_type SHIPMENT_PACK and modification_level SHIPMENT.
        Kit component containerization is not supported by packShipment.

        The processing logic of the API is as follows:
        1. Call the beforePackShipment user exit to allow modification of XML to conform to packShipment input XML or to default additional parameters.
        2. Carry out input validations as detailed within the Validations section.
        3. For each container in the input XML:
          1. Create shipment container(YFS_SHIPMENT_CONTAINER). If ContainerNo is not specified, pick up the next number from the database sequence object SEQ_YFS_CONTAINER_NO.
          2. Obtain an open manifest for the shipment's ship node and carrier if the carrier is a PARCEL carrier. Update shipment with the manifest (YFS_SHIPMENT.manifest_key is set to YFS_MANIFEST.manifest_key).
          3. Insert instructions (YFS_INSTRUCTION_DETAIL), special services (YFS_SPECIAL_SERVICE_REF) and container additional attributes (YFS_ADDITIONAL_ATTRIBUTES).
          4. Get the Shipment line for each ContainerDetail from YFS_SHIPMENT_LINE. Pick up uncontainerized ShipmentTagSerials for the line and match the input ShipmentTagSerial for Tagattributes and SerialNo. Replace the ShipmentTagSerials with ones which have ContainerDetailKey and for remaining quantity create new ShipmentTagSerial. If any quantity could not be packed, an error is thrown.
          5. Carrier on the shipment requires carrier integration either for domestic or international shipments, perform calls to the carrier server.
        4. Update shipment with the total of the freight charges of all containers. Set the shipment's containerized status as follows:
          • 02 - if partially containerized
          • 03 - if completely containerized

        Note: Although the XML input to the API specifies ZeroOrMany Container, the API processes only one Container. If other containers are passed, they will be ignored. ZeroOrMany is reserved for future use.

        Validations:
      • One of ShipmentKey or ShipmentNo, ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode must be passed. This should point to a valid shipment.
      • ShipmentLineKey attribute or ShipmentLine element must be made available in the input XML for each container detail.
      • The shipment status must be one of the statuses defined for the shipment modification rules for the modification type SHIPMENT_PACK, unless OverrideModificationRules is set to Y, in which status check will not be carried out. Shipment should not be closed.
      • Container detail with items that are set up as time sensitive (in YFS_ITEM) must have Shipment Tag Serials with ShipByDate specified for entire quantity .
      • Container detail with items that are set up as serialized (in YFS_ITEM) must have Shipment Tag Serials with SerialNo specified for entire quantity .
      • Container detail with items that are set up as tag tracked (in YFS_ITEM) must have Shipment Tag Serials with TagNumber, which is derived from inventory, for entire quantity.
      • Shipment must have a SCAC (carrier) associated with it.
      • If Parent Container No is passed in Container element, the Parent Container must already exist.
      • If total TagSerial quantity is greater then ContainerDetail quantity then error YDM00121
      • If ShipmentLineInvAttRequest child node under ShipmentLine is given and OrderAvailableOnSystem on Shipment is N then ItemID, ProductClass, UnitOfMeasure is required else error YFS10050

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
        Before performing any operations on the input XML passed to it, this API calls the following user exit:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforePackShipment.
        The following user exit is called for shipment container weight computation when the same isn't passed in the input:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetOverridenAttributesForShipmentLineItemUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction YDM_PACK_SHIPMENT.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of packShipment.
            Data published - YDM_PACK_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            DTD - YDM_PACK_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key Data - shipment_dbd.txt

              Template Support: Yes
              However, note that the template name would read <Transaction ID>.ON_SUCCESS.xml. The XML and DTD depicted above
              represent the output that the transaction PACK_SHIPMENT is capable of generating.

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:
        Shipment lines are containerized and shipment containerization state is updated appropriately (as detailed above).

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains all the information about the container. The output contains only those containers that were packed as specified in the input XML. To get a complete list of containers in the shipment, use the getShipmentDetails API. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
